result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lawrence Richard Kinnucan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, Lawrence Richard Kinnucan was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court.  Defendant Lawrence Richard Kinnucan not in court; in custody, but appears by video teleconference.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Parties in court for hearing on conditional release.
Hearing commences.
Sworn and testified:  Dr. Brooke Lundbohm.  Parties review report; statements to the court.
Court finds that the defendant would be harmful to himself or others at this time; and denies petition for conditional release based on the doctor's testimony.  Defendant is to continue and expand his participation in treatment.
No adjourn court date at this time.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney has not had an opportunity to review the report with defendant.  Attorney requests this matter be scheduled for a hearing.  State notified via email that Dr. Brooke Lundbohm be subpoenaed.  Video technician notified of the need to schedule a video conference with defendant who is at Mendota.  Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Report from Mendota Mental Health dated November 9, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant's conditional release petition addressed.   Court appoints Dr. Brooke Lundbohm from the Forensic Unit to conduct examination.  Order for Predisposition Investigation signed and filed.  Order forwarded to Forensic Unit.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lawrence Richard Kinnucan in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Lawrence Richard Kinnucan in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Hearing as to placement.  Hearing proceeded.  Sworn:  Steven Genheimer, M.D. appears via video conferencing.  On state's motion the Court receives report authored by Dr. Genheimer (dated 9-6-14) as the doctor's findings.  Offer of proof made by defense.  Statements by defense and the state.  The Court sets forth findings and ruling on the record.  The Court finds that the state has met its burden by clear and convincing evidence.  The Court orders that the defendant receive institutional care and recommends Mendota.  The Court finds the state has not met it's burden for involuntary medication order.  Filed, signed Order for Placement.

Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Copy of transcript forwarded to MEGAN CARMODY
                                                     ASSISTANT DISTRICT ATTORNEY

Defendant Lawrence Richard Kinnucan in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer, and attorney Paige Styler.  Defendant Lawrence Richard Kinnucan in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waives his right to a Jury trial.  PHASE I.

Exhibit 1 (Report by Dr. Lundbohm) offered, marked, and received into evidence.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On the motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  The Court will except the report and the findings made by Dr. Lundbohm. The Court finds the Defendant suffers from Mental Disease or Defect. The Court makes a finding of Guilt, as to Count 1. The Court ordered a Supplementary Mental Examination (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) and an Order of Commitment (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) by DHS. The Court ordered proceedings suspended.  Case adjourned for a Return on Doctor's Report in Branch 21.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Invoice forwarded to A/P on 07-22-2014 in the amount of $812.50 to Dr. Lundbohm for services on 06/09, 09/11, 06/19/2014.

The state does not challenge the report.  Parties request date for Phase I and Phase II as to ngi plea.  Court trial scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Lawrence Richard Kinnucan not in court, in custody.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter scheduled on today for Doctor's Report Return.  Parties advised that Dr. Brooke Lundbohm has requested an extension of time to submit report.  No objection by the parties.  New date selected with counsel.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence Richard Kinnucan in court with Attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Kristin M Schrank for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Original Information on file.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Information, waived its reading.  Defense counsel entered a plea not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect on behalf of the client. Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit as to the special plea.   The Court orders proceedings suspended at this time.  The Court has no objection to 14CM350 being transferred to Branch 21 for global resolution.  The Court ordered the defendant REMANDED.  Order For Examination under 971.16, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.
  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
